intro: Anil aspera, commonly known as rough anise, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. The plant is native to regions of Europe and Asia and thrives in temperate climates. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides due to its adaptability. The aromatic seeds of Anil aspera have been used historically in traditional medicine and as a spice.
